explanation: The report is correct. In metal_uio_dev_bind the code calls strlen(ldrv->drv_name) (and also uses ldrv->drv_name in strcmp earlier) but ldrv->drv_name is declared as const char * and there is no validation in this function that it is non-NULL and points to a NUL-terminated buffer. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 requires that uses of string.h functions must not access beyond the bounds of the referenced objects — calling strlen on a NULL pointer or on a non NUL-terminated buffer can read out of bounds and thus violate the rule. (Note: ldev->dev_name is an array char[PATH_MAX] so it is less likely to be a NULL-pointer problem, but its termination is still an independent concern. Also the function already calls strcmp(ldev->sdev->driver_name, ldrv->drv_name) which similarly assumes valid NUL-terminated strings.) If there are external, provable invariants guaranteeing drv_name is non-NULL and NUL-terminated, the use is acceptable; absent such guarantees the code violates Rule 21.17. Recommended fixes: validate pointers before use (e.g. check for NULL), use bounded APIs (e.g. strnlen with documented limits), or document and enforce the invariant that drv_name is a valid NUL-terminated string.
